text: Spurgeon is a census-designated place (CDP) in Sullivan and Washington counties in the U.S. state of Tennessee. The population was 3,978 at the 2020 census. It is a part of the Johnson City-Kingsport-Bristol, TN-VA Combined Statistical Area - commonly known as the "Tri-Cities" region. ==History== During the American Civil War, a small battle known as the Battle of Spurgeonâ€™s Mill happened here. ==References== Category:Tri-Cities, Tennessee Category:Census-designated places in Tennessee Category:Sullivan County, Tennessee Category:Washington County, Tennessee
title: Spurgeon, Tennessee
